docs.title: Preface
docs.text: In this section introduction the purpose of this document and book.

docs.title: Why read this book?
docs.text:
• Python easy to learn but important good knowledge.
  • Use code and library but not understand it.
  • No academia learn python.
  • No an A-to-Z book.
  • Also mostly a book about the core language and some of its libraries.
  • Who want to become proficient.
  • Not for just learning Python.
  • Categorize content in mind*

docs.title: Main topics
docs.text: Here are the main topics in each part of the book

docs.title: Data Structures
docs.text:
• Data model
  • Array of Sequence
  • Dictionaries and Sets
  • Unicode Text Versus Bytes
  • Data Class Builders
  • Object References, Mutability, and Recycling

docs.title: Functions as Objects
docs.text:
• Functions as First-Class Objects
  • Type Hints in Functions
  • Decorators and Closures
  • Design Patterns with First-Class Functions

docs.title: Classes and Protocols
docs.text:
• A Pythonic Object
  • Special Methods for Sequences
  • Interfaces, Protocols, and ABCs
  • Inheritance: For Better or for Worse
  • More About Type Hints
  • Operator Overloading

docs.title: Control Flow
docs.text:
• Iterators, Generators, and Classic Coroutines
  • with, match, and else Blocks
  • Concurrency Models in Python
  • Concurrent Executors
  • Asynchronous Programming
